meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'bit': having more bits.
meanings.sent1: The new computer is bitsier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was bitsier than mine.
meanings.sent3: I never knew a computer could get bitsier!
meanings.sent4: The room felt bitsier with all the extra decorations.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle became bitsier as more pieces were added.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'bit': consisting of smaller pieces or parts.
meanings.sent1: The bitsier cake was easier to share among friends.
meanings.sent2: The bitsier Lego set was more challenging to assemble.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made the sandwich bitsier by cutting it into small squares.
meanings.sent4: The bitsier jigsaw puzzle required more focus to complete.
meanings.sent5: The bitsier necklace had intricate details on each tiny charm.
